name: Zuma Canyon
description:
Introduction

Approach

Descent

Exit

The Chris Brennen beta says after climbing the steep rocky slope at the end and proceeding through some bushes to turn left and proceed south, however the trail to the left appears to branch off a few times into dead-ends or trails back into Newton Canyon. Turning right after crawling through the bushes instead leads to the Backbone Trail where you can proceed south.

Red tape

Beta sites

  • Chris Brennen's Adventure Hikes (Southwest) : Zuma Canyon

properties.name: Wpt2
properties.description: After the first stretch of bouldering the canyon flattens out temporarily and here at an elevation of 800ft and 2hr 15min from the start you come the the place where the aforementioned Kanan Edison Road crosses the creek at (Data by brennen.caltech.edu/swhikes)

properties.name: Wpt3
properties.description: They meet in a tranquil wooded and relatively flat section of canyon bottom at (Data by brennen.caltech.edu/swhikes)

properties.name: Wpt4
properties.description: Then it switchbacks up the hillside to the Backbone Trail parking lot where you left the return vehicle or bicycles at (Data by brennen.caltech.edu/swhikes)

properties.name: Wpt5
properties.description: 9mi back to the Zuma Canyon trailhead (Data by brennen.caltech.edu/swhikes)
